referralInfo.reasonForReferral: Post-stroke rehabilitation assessment and home modification recommendations

functionalHistory.priorLevelOfFunction: Independent in all ADLs and IADLs. Retired elementary school teacher. Active with community senior center and church activities. Enjoyed cooking, gardening, and visiting with grandchildren.
functionalHistory.priorLivingArrangement: Lived alone in third-floor apartment with elevator access.
functionalHistory.priorMobilityStatus: Independent ambulation without assistive devices. Used public transportation or drove personal vehicle.
functionalHistory.recentChanges: Following CVA on December 28, 2024, experienced right-sided weakness, aphasia, and balance impairments. Hospitalized for 5 days followed by 2 weeks of inpatient rehabilitation. Daughter (45) has temporarily moved in to provide assistance.

physicalSymptoms.description: Significant weakness in right arm with limited active range of motion
physicalSymptoms.impactOnFunction: Unable to use right arm for functional activities including dressing, grooming, and meal preparation

physicalSymptoms.description: Weakness most notable with hip flexion and ankle dorsiflexion
physicalSymptoms.impactOnFunction: Requires front-wheeled walker for ambulation, unable to navigate stairs independently

physicalSymptoms.aggravatingFactors: Uneven surfaces, crowded environments, quick movements
physicalSymptoms.impactOnFunction: High fall risk, requires supervision for all mobility

cognitiveSymptoms.description: Difficulty finding words and forming complete sentences
cognitiveSymptoms.impactOnFunction: Frustration with communication, unable to have complex conversations

cognitiveSymptoms.description: Occasionally forgets recent conversations or misplaces items
cognitiveSymptoms.impactOnFunction: Needs reminders for medications and appointments

mobilityAssessment.bedMobility: Requires minimal assistance for rolling and supine-to-sit
mobilityAssessment.ambulation: Ambulates with front-wheeled walker with contact guard assistance for 100 feet before requiring rest
mobilityAssessment.balance: Poor standing balance with eyes closed, moderate sitting balance
mobilityAssessment.assistiveDevices: Front-wheeled walker, bedside commode, shower chair

upperExtremityFunction.rightShoulderROM: Limited to 90Â° flexion and abduction due to weakness
upperExtremityFunction.fineMotorSkills: Unable to perform fine motor tasks with right hand, learning to use left hand for basic activities

typicalDay.morningRoutine: Awakens at 6:30 AM. Daughter helps with transfer to bedside commode. Requires moderate assistance for dressing and grooming. Morning routine takes approximately 90 minutes with rest breaks.
typicalDay.daytimeActivities: Spends majority of day in living room recliner with positioned right arm. Attends outpatient therapy three times weekly. Practices speech exercises and does simple arm and leg exercises as tolerated. Daughter prepares all meals.
typicalDay.eveningRoutine: Evening routine begins at 8:00 PM with assistance for hygiene and changing into night clothes. Takes evening medications at 9:00 PM. Sleep is interrupted 2-3 times nightly for toileting needs.

homeLayout.entryAccess: No steps at building entrance, apartment has threshold at door
homeLayout.bedroomLocation: Single-level apartment with bedroom adjacent to living room
homeLayout.bathroomLocation: One bathroom off the main hallway with step-in shower/tub combination

safetyAssessment.trippingHazards: Multiple area rugs, cluttered pathways, electrical cords
safetyAssessment.lightingAdequacy: Poor lighting in bathroom and hallway
safetyAssessment.bathroomSafety: No grab bars installed in shower/tub or near toilet
safetyAssessment.emergencyPlan: Daughter stays with client, has emergency contact list on refrigerator

basicADLs.feeding: Requires setup assistance, uses left hand for self-feeding
basicADLs.bathing: Requires moderate assistance for shower with shower chair
basicADLs.dressing: Moderate assistance for all dressing tasks
basicADLs.toileting: Minimal assistance for transfers to/from toilet, needs help with clothing management

instrumentalADLs.mealPreparation: Unable to prepare meals independently due to weakness and balance issues
instrumentalADLs.householdManagement: Unable to perform household tasks independently
instrumentalADLs.financialManagement: Needs assistance with bill paying and banking due to cognitive and motor limitations
instrumentalADLs.medicationManagement: Requires setup and reminders for medications
instrumentalADLs.communityMobility: Unable to use public transportation or drive independently

leisureRecreation.socialActivities: Phone calls with friends, limited visitors due to fatigue
leisureRecreation.hobbiesInterests: Listening to audiobooks, watching television, short periods of looking at photo albums

homeManagement.cleaning: Maximum assistance for all household cleaning

communityAccess.shopping: Maximum assistance for all shopping needs
